subject: Re: [junit] Junitreport runs out of memory.
msgSnippet: ... This happens when there is a lot of console output. One hack is to use the noframes stylesheet, which does not display console output. (Of course, if you
messageBody:
Ray Tayek wrote:

> Hi, tring to run the junit tests for hibernate. When I turn on debug
> logging, I get an out of memory error. Trying to add a jvmarg to in crease
> the heap fails since that task says it does not support jvmarg.
>
> Does anyone know of a workaround.

This happens when there is a lot of console output. One hack is to use
the "noframes" stylesheet, which does not display console output. (Of
course, if you need logging on, then that might not help.)

Another workaround would be to redirect debug logging away from stdout
and to something like a file. That way you get the logging output, but
junit-report doesn't process it (and run out of memory).

This might also be a Xalan defect. I remember reading that somewhere.
Search the archives of this group for "xalan memory" and maybe you'll
find it. If you're not using the latest Xalan, then upgrade.

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
